lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are
instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.Duke.main()` (if the
code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something
like the below as the output:
* Handles connections between ui, storage, parser and TaskList
* Specifies the location of the save file to load from
* @param fileDirectory directory of the save file
* @param fileName      name of the save file
* Starts sensing the input as commands
* Triggers UI to print the tasks
* Adds a task from Save file Representation form
* @param arguments arguments like task name and datetime in string
public void addTask(TaskList.Tasktype type, String... arguments) {
* Called when taskList is updated to save the TaskList to save file
* Called to interface with TaskList to remove a task by index
* @param toRemove index of task to remove
* Called to interface with TaskList to remove all current tasks
* Called to mark an index as incomplete
* @param index the index to mark as incomplete
* Called to make an index of task as complete
* @param index index to mark as complete
* Specifies the names of commands Duke uses
* Converts user input to make sense of user command
public static final Map<String, BiPredicate<Chatbot, String>> commands
* Hooks onto a chatbot and its ui
* Checks if the Userinput is valid and calls the corresponding BiFunction
* @param nextLine Next line of User Input
* TaskList keeps tracks of all operations related to
* the current tasks, as well as manipulation of tasks
* Loads the tasklist from save file representation
* @param tasks List of tasks in save file representation
* If no save file is found, create an empty TaskList
* Converts this TaskList's contents to Save File Representation
* @return Save File Representation of this TaskList's tasks
* Returns the User Representation of a specific task at an index
* @param index index of task to query
* Checks if the index specified corresponds to a Task in TaskList
* @param index index of task to query
* @return True if task index corresponds to a task, false otherwise
* Removes and returns a task at a specific index
* @param toRemove Index of task to be removed
* Returns the number of tasks currently in this TaskList
* @return The number of tasks currently in this TaskList
* Returns the completion state of a task specified by the input index
* @param index the index of the Task to query
* @return Returns true if task corresponding to this index is completed, false otherwise
* Toggles the state of a task specified by the input index
* @param index the index of the Task to toggle state
* Adds a task to the TaskList
* Changes this TaskList into User Representation form
* @return This TaskList in User Representation form
* Converts a task in Save File Representation form into its corresponding
* @param type      Enum specifying the type of Task to generate
* @param arguments Array of strings representing the name and optionally the DateTime in string
* @return Returns the Task generated from this Save File Representation form.
* @throws DateTimeParseException         Throws this Error if DateTime String given cannot be parsed
* @throws UnimplementedTaskTypeException Throws this Error if Tasktype given does not match an implemented Task
public Task convertToTask(Tasktype type, String[] arguments)
* Removes all elements from this TaskList
* Returns a new TaskList where each element's User Representation contains the keyword
*  Specifies the Tasktypes currently supported by TaskList
* Handles the output to be printed to user.
* Error message to be shown to user when an error
* Error message to be shown to user when
* index user specified is larger than the size of the list
System.out.println("Error: Index specified must be smaller than current list size.");
* Error message to be shown to user when
* user does not specify an index in Delete
* Message to be shown to user when a task has been successfully added to the list
* @param taskMessage    User representation of the task that has just been added
* @param newTasksLength length of tasks after this addition
public void showTaskAddedMessage(String taskMessage, int newTasksLength) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
private void showTaskEditedMessage(String taskMessage, int newTasksLength) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + newTasksLength + " tasks in the list");
* Message to be shown to user on startup
String MESSAGE_START = "What can I do for you?";
* Message to be shown to user when message is successfully removed from the list
* @param taskMessage User representation of the message successfully removed
* @param taskLength  Length of the list after this removal
public void showRemovedTaskMessage(String taskMessage, int taskLength) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've removed this task:");
* Shows the User representation of the tasks that are currently in the list
* @param tasks User representation of the tasks that are currently in the list
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Error message to be shown when task the user is trying to mark
System.out.println("Task is already marked as done.");
* Message to be shown when the task a user is trying to mark
* @param taskMessage User representation of the task the user has just marked
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Error message to be shown to the user if the task a user is trying to unmark
System.out.println("Task is already marked as incompelted.");
* Message to be shown to the user if the task a user is trying to unmark
* @param taskMessage User Representation of the task the user has just unmarked.
System.out.println("I have maked this task as incomplete:");
* Error message to be shown to the user if no Description is given
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* Error message to be shown to the user if Deadline Command is called
System.out.println("Error: Invalid number of args. Pls add a /by in your command, " +
"or ensure task name is not not empty");
* Error message to be shown to the user if Event Command is called
System.out.println("Error: Invalid number of args. Pls add a /from and /to in your command," +
" or ensure task name is not not empty");
* Error message to be shown to the user if Duke does not recognise
* the command that has been entered
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Error message to be shown to user if Command given included an invalid datetime
* Error message to be shown to user if Save data contains unimplemented task types
System.out.println("Error: Task type is not implemented");
* Message to be shown to user if Deleteall command is run
* Message to be shown to user if list is called
* when no tasks are in the list.
System.out.println("There are no tasks to print!");
* Error message to be shown when Find command is called
System.out.println("Error: Find has no keyword to find for");
* Message to be shown when Find command is called
* @param args Keyword entered into find command
System.out.println("Finding tasks related to keyword: " + args);
* DukeException is thrown when Duke is unable to read the savefile's contents,
* or if the savefile is corrupted / altered wrongly.
* UnimplementedTaskTypeException occurs if the save file has saved an event type
* that is not yet implemented in Duke.
* DeadlineTask is a task that only has a end date.
* @param dueDate  LocalDateTime to complete this task by
* Converts the Information from save file to load as a DeadlineTask
* Converts the DeadlineTask to a String to save in file
* @return Representation of DeadlineTask in save file
* Converts the DeadlineTask to a String to be shown to user
* EventTask is a task that has a start and end date
* @param startDate LocalDateTime to start of Event
* @param dueDate   LocalDateTime to end of Event
public EventTask(String taskName, LocalDateTime startDate, LocalDateTime dueDate) {
* Loads Information from save file representation as a EventTask
* @param input Information from save file to load
* @return EventTask generated from save file representation
* Converts EventTask to save file representation
* Converts EventTask to string for user
* Abstract class to represent a Task.
* Has a taskName and completionStatus, which all tasks have.
* Abstract constructor for Task to set taskName.
* Toggles the completion status of this task
* converts to completed task if task was not completed
* converts to uncompleted task if task was completed
* Returns the completion status of this task
* @return the completion status of this task
* Loads the completion status from save file representation
* @param inp Loads the completion status of this task from save file representation
* Abstract method to convert this task to save file representation
* @return Converts this Task to save file representation
* Converts this task into a string for user
* @return Converts this Task into a string for user
* The most basic task TodoTask implements task and accepts a task Name.
* @param input Save file representation of this TodoTask
* @return TodoTask generated from Save file representation
* Converts this TodoTask to save file representation
* @return Converts this TodoTask to Save file representation
* Converts this TodoTask to a string for user
* @return Converts this TodoTask to string for user
